page.title: 11FARMING
page.content: Most of the farms in this area are mixed stock-rearing - that is suckler cow herds where the calves are sold as store or fattened before selling. Cross lambs from a Blackface dam and a Border Leicester sire are reared for the same purpose. Lambing takes place in March and April mainly and calving in Spring or Autumn. The grassland is grazed or used to make silage or hay. Barley is grown for winter feed-both the grain and straw are used.Rape,turnips and kale play a small part in some feeding schemes. There is only one dairy unit in this area.
